Bibliographic References: Once Cologne Market, Lempertz, Sale Cat. no. 585 (19Non Sepcified21 Nov. 1981), no. 1715, ill. on pi. 138; now with the Ariadne Galleries, New York. Ht. 32Non Sepcified3.
Imagery Description: (a) Seated woman, (b) seated nude youth with mirror. Lid: (i) lekanis—(a) female head, [b) male head; (ii) bowl of lebes—female heads.
Additional Notes: The heads on the lid of this vase show it to be approaching the style of the Painter of Naples 1778; that on the reverse of the bowl is extremely close to those on the neckNon Sepcifiedamphora Madrid 11261, and has the same fanNon Sepcifiedpalmette with sprung leaves beside it. The youth on the reverse is the prototype of those on vases like Paestum 1275, 32866, but there the drawing is coarser.
Artist: Minor Vases from the AsteasNon SepcifiedPython Workshop
